notesStmt.note: Shemu᾿el ha-Rofe: inscribed in the colophon, folio 2r. Mordekhai, Rafa᾿el ben Mosheh ha-Melamed and Mosheh ben Benyamin of Bologne: inscribed in the contract of sale, folio 1r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Sefer ha-ḥinukh, a commentary on the 613 precepts arranged in the order of the weekly parashiyot.

collation.p: 30 quires of mostly 10 leaves each, marked with catchwords and Hebrew letters at the end. Quires no. 12, 21, 22, 25 have 8 leaves each, quire no. 30 has 6 leaves only.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the 14th century. Avraham (?), the scribe: his name marked off within the text.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Sefer Ha Chinnuk. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2855.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: N. Rabinowitz: bought from him by the British Museum on 18 April 1885 (folio [290v]).
